definition: to observe and make sure/to check
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard

sentences.english: Lin Lei saw the opportunity to ridicule Bai righteousness, want him to hold.
sentences.chinese: 林磊看準機會乘機奚落柏義，要他來執籌碼。

sentences.english: A miracle will soon appear, "eyes opened wide points, sights poker."
sentences.chinese: 奇蹟即將出現，“眼睛睜大點，看準撲克牌。”

sentences.english: The Southwest Airlines was able to see the silver lines in the cloud and profit from the oil crisis.
sentences.chinese: 西南航空公司看準油價行情，變成危機中的贏家。

sentences.english: If they attack, concentrate your forces and attack his weakness.
sentences.chinese: 如果敵人進攻，就集中兵力看準敵人的破綻去打擊它。

sentences.english: Chongqing Xidishan Days Hotel just gets hold of such an opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 而重慶喜地山戴斯大酒店，正是看準了這樣一個契機。

sentences.english: Once you have decide you are going to kiss someone, choose your moment and go for it.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你決定要吻這個人，看準時機就立刻行動。

sentences.english: She watched her moment to cross the road.
ICI is also targeting the housing construction market.
sentences.chinese: ICI同時還看準了民用住宅建設市場。

sentences.english: The fighter's well-aimed blow curled his opponent up.
sentences.chinese: 那位拳擊手看準目標，一拳把對手打垮了。

sentences.english: This allows Mahone and Michael to sneak into Tuxhorn's house and find the device.
sentences.chinese: 馬宏和邁可看準機會，溜了進去，及時拿回了設備。

sentences.english: They saw the great opportunity to corner the market and earned a lot of money.

sentences.english: Qin saw the opportunity, first with Qi Lianheng, Wei introduction of large tracts of land.
sentences.chinese: 秦國看準時機，先與齊連橫，攻略魏國大片土地。

sentences.english: To see in order to focus one eye on the worm .
sentences.chinese: 向看去，以便使一隻眼睛能看準蟲子。
